message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: String input = "key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3&key4=value4&key5=value5";
HashMap<String, String> map = new HashMap<>();

StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, "&");
while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
    String token = st.nextToken();
    String[] keyValue = token.split("=");
    String key = keyValue[0];
    String value = keyValue[1];
    map.put(key, value);
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we first create a HashMap object called "map". Then, we create a StringTokenizer object "st" and pass the input string and "&" as the delimiters. We iterate through the tokens using a while loop and for each token, we split it using the "=" delimiter to separate the key and value. We then store the key-value pair in the HashMap using the put() method.
